lead_paragraph: Under longstanding antitrust policy, the AT&T-Time Warner deal should be practically a shoo-in. But these are not usual times.

headline.print_headline: Why a Merger of Media Firms That Should Be a Sure Bet Isn’t
headline.main: Why a Media Merger That Should Go Through Might Not

snippet: Under longstanding antitrust policy, the AT&T-Time Warner deal should be practically a shoo-in. But these are not usual times....
abstract: James B Stewart Common Sense column suggests arguments against merger of AT&T and Time Warner show shift in antitrust ideology, in which concern has shifted back toward early 20th-century fear of putting too much power in too few hands, rather than emphasizing prices, competition and efficiency; notes that this influential shift may prevent deal from being approved.
